summary: An email from attorney Jill Greenfield to an unspecified recipient regarding arranging an interview in London with her client, who is a victim of sexual assault in the UK and asserts her right to automatic anonymity under UK law. The email seeks to confirm the parameters of the interviewer's interest before scheduling.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Author of the email representing a client who is a victim of sexual assault in the UK, seeking to arrange an interview while asserting the client's right to anonymity.

events.title: Potential Interview Arrangement
events.description: Discussion about arranging an interview in London between an unspecified interviewer and Jill Greenfield's client, who is a victim of sexual assault.

locations: Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT
keyFacts: The email is from attorney Jill Greenfield regarding her client, who is a victim of sexual assault that occurred in the UK.
The client asserts her right to automatic anonymity under UK Statute as a victim of sexual assault in the UK and does not waive that right.
The purpose is to arrange an interview in London and to confirm the parameters of the interviewer's interest in the client.
